results.title: Bridge to space
results.creator_credit: Charles R. Trieschman, Seneca Productions, National Aeronautics and Space Administration and Robert Gaffney
results.brief_description: A bus tour visits the Cape Kennedy Moonport of Project Apollo, recording the impressive sights of the Moonport, of Project A, the Saturn Rockets, the launching pads and control facilities. The tour conductor gives details of the sights.

results.title: Bridge over the Bosporus
results.creator_credit: Turner Film Productions and Michael Bennett
results.brief_description: A record of the building of the bridge across the Bosporus which divides the city of Istanbul. The bridge was opened in October 1973. Narrated by John Carson.

results.title: Bridge over Myall Creek (A)
results.creator_credit: Caitlin Shea, Margaret Parker, Wendy Page, John Millard, Helen Gasswill, Vanessa Gorman, Brigid Donovan, Samantha Butler and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian story (Television program)”.
Caroline Jones introduces this episode of “Australian story” which looks at personal reconciliation in action as demonstrated by the relationship between Sue Blacklock and Beulah Adams, descendants of victim and perpetrator in the 1838 Myall Creek massacre. Researching into her family history, Beulah Adams discovered her great uncle was one of the perpetrators in a massacre that saw 28 Aborigines killed. Beulah talks candidly about her reaction to the news, and her experience at meeting Sue Blacklock, descendant of one of the two survivors at a conference on reconciliation convened by Reverend John Brown. Another descendant of the perpetrators, Des Blake, talks about his experience at attending the memorial’s opening at Myall Creek in 2002, and how the experience has changed his life since then.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Caitlin Shea, Margaret Parker, Wendy Page, John Millard, Helen Gasswill, Vanessa Gorman, Brigid Donovan, Samantha Butler and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Pt. 1 [episodes 1-5]
results.creator_credit: Derek Granger, Granada International Productions and Charles Sturridge
results.brief_description: This tape comprises of episodes one to five - the first half of the magnificent series set during World War II. It is dawn on a cold winter’s morning in 1943. Charles Ryder, painter turned army captain, in the twilight of World War II has marched most of the night and camped with his platoon at their secret destination. On waking, he is amazed to find he is at the rear of Brideshead Castle where he spent many years of enchantment and grief in his youth, and which, years ago he had left vowing never to return. Now here he was again, cold and with memories flooding over him like storm-surf on the shore. He was back. Brideshead revisited had begun. Cast includes Jeremy Irons, Anthony Andrews, Diana Quick, Laurence Olivier, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud. Adapted from the novel by Evelyn Waugh.

results.title: Brides of Christ (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sue Masters, ABC-TV (Australia) and Ken Cameron
results.brief_description: A six hour mini-series based on the lives of Sr. Catherine and Sr. Paul who enter the convent in the early 50’s. Behind high convent walls, their lives are circumscribed by centuries old traditions, rites and disciplines, yet they must become part of a changing world. For many, their faith will be sufficient to carry them through their personal crisis. In their care are spirited teenagers, schooled in the old creed, yet eager to taste the new freedoms. Starring Brenda Fricker, Sandy Gore, Josephine Byrnes, Lisa Hensley, Naomi Watts and Kym Wilson.

results.title: Bride of Chucky
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Grace Gilroy, David Kirschner and Ronny Yu
results.brief_description: This is the fourth, and without a doubt the best in the controversial ‘Child’s play’ series. In the latest instalment Chucky (voiced supplied by Brad Dourif), the benevolent child’s toy is bought back to life in this inventive and witty sequel which plays more like a demented homage to ‘Bride of Frankenstein’. The sinister looking doll which is possessed by the evil spirit of a serial killer is resurrected from the dead by his unbalanced goth girlfriend (played with relish by Jennifer Tilly), who has wedding bells on her mind. However Chucky has more sinister intentions than marriage, when he and his trailer trash bride stow away with two runaway teens wrongly accused of murder. Hong Kong director Ronny Yu (‘Bride with the white hair’), and writer Don Mancini have fashioned a wonderfully irresponsible film which proudly wears it’s horror film references on its sleeve, giving the series some surreal, clever twists and turns. Cast also includes John Ritter, Alexis Arquette and Katherine Heigl.

results.title: Bride and groom
results.brief_description: An experiment in animation technique produced by a group of amateur film makers, about a newly wed couple who cannot get rid of a door-to-door salesman. Pixillated technique is used in which the principles of animation are applied to real people rather than inanimate materials such as drawings and three-dimensional puppets.

results.title: Bricks and mortar
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Brian Bergin and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Explains how and why sources are allocated for adult education in South Australia.
